qas.question: After emigration from the west, did Jewish communities in places like Poland have a stable or unstable sociopolitical environment?
What precipitated the development of the Hasidic movement?

answers.text: A thriving publishing industry and the printing of hundreds of biblical commentaries

qas.question: Massive western emigration occurred around what time?
Ashkenazi Jews have made up the majority of the American Jewish community since when?

context: In the generations after emigration from the west, Jewish communities in places like Poland, Russia, and Belarus enjoyed <a0_0>a comparatively stable socio-political environment<a0_0/>. <a1_0>A thriving publishing industry and the printing of hundreds of biblical commentaries<a1_0/> precipitated the development of the Hasidic movement as well as major Jewish academic centers. After two centuries of comparative tolerance in the new nations, massive westward emigration occurred <a2_0>in the 19th and 20th centuries<a2_0/> in response to pogroms in the east and the economic opportunities offered in other parts of the world. Ashkenazi Jews have made up the majority of the American Jewish community since <a3_0>1750<a3_0/>.
